items.title: Wall Street ends lower as Nvidia, tech stocks weigh | REUTERS
items.author: Reuters
items.content:
Wall Street closed lower, led by a decline in Nvidia stocks, which fell 2.5% after China's market regulator launched an antitrust investigation into the chipmaker, dragging the information technology sector down.

#News #usastocks #wallstreet #nvidia #china #Reuters #Newsfeed

items.title: GRAPHIC WARNING: Former US Marine acquitted in NYC subway chokehold death | REUTERS
items.author: Reuters
items.content:
A New York jury acquitted ex-Marine Daniel Penny of criminally negligent homicide in the death of Jordan Neely, a homeless man he restrained with a chokehold on a subway in May 2023.

#News #newyork #jordanneely #Reuters #Newsfeed

items.title: Luigi Mangione, suspect in killing of UnitedHealth executive, in custody | REUTERS
items.author: Reuters
items.content:
Authorities have arrested Luigi Mangione - the man suspected of killing UnitedHealth executive Brian Thompson in a shooting outside a Manhattan hotel last week - ending a massive five-day manhunt.

items.title: Google claims huge quantum computing advance | REUTERS
items.author: Reuters
items.content:
Google said that it has overcome a key challenge in quantum computing with a new generation of chip, solving a computing problem in five minutes that would take a classical computer more time than the history of the universe.

#google #quantumcomputing #chip #willow #qubits #News #Tech #Technology #Reuters #Newsfeed

items.title: How the world could unplug from Chinaâ€™s batteries
items.author: Reuters
items.content: International cell makers are struggling  (https://www.reuters.com/breakingviews/chinas-global-battery-ram-will-be-hard-stop-2024-09-06/) to compete with Chinese giants like CATL (https://www.reuters.com/breakingviews/catl-earnings-slip-masks-charged-up-ambitions-2024-03-18/) . But innovations like solid-state batteries (https://www.reuters.com/breakingviews/ev-tariffs-are-only-first-step-eu-china-war-2024-10-04/)  could upend the industry in the not-too-distant future. In this weekâ€™s episode of The Big View podcast, QuantumScape CEO Siva Sivaram explains how.

items.title: LIVE: Damascus after Syrian rebels ousted Bashar al-Assad | REUTERS
items.author: Reuters
items.content:
View of Damascus as the Islamist-led rebels settle in to take control of the city, after President Bashar al-Assad was ousted. 

The lightning overthrow of Assad left Syrians, countries in the region and world powers nervous about what comes next as the rebel alliance took its first steps in a government transition.

#rebels #HayatTahriralSham #HTS #Damascus #Syria #live #Reuters #news

Keep up with the latest news from around the world: https://www.reuters.com/

items.title: LIVE: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu arrives at court for corruption trial | REUTERS
items.author: Reuters
items.content:
Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu arrives at court in Tel Aviv for the first time in his long-running corruption trial, under a court order that could force him to juggle between the courtroom and the war room for weeks.

#Netanyahu #BenjaminNetanyahu #court #corruption #trial #TelAviv #Israel #live #Reuters #news

Keep up with the latest news from around the world: https://www.reuters.com/

items.title: LIVE: Thousands of protesters are expected to gather in front of the parliament in Seoul, South Kâ€¦
items.author: Reuters
items.content:
Thousands of protesters gather in front of the parliament in Seoul, demanding the impeachment and arrest of President Yoon Suk Yeol, as well as the disbandment of his ruling party following last week's martial law attempt. The demonstrators have pledged to continue their civil movement until President Yoon is removed from office.

#protest #parliament #Seoul #impeachment #arrest #YoonSukYeol #martiallaw #demonstrators #PresidentYoon #live #Reuters #News

Keep up with the latest news from around the world: https://www.reuters.com/

items.title: LIVE: UN Special Envoy for Syria gives an update on the situation in the country
items.author: Reuters
items.content:
UN Special Envoy for Syria, Geir O. Pedersen, briefs the media after rebel forces seized the capital of Damascus over the weekend. Other UN agencies, including UNHCR are also expected to give an update on the situation in the country.

#UNSpecialEnvoy #Syria #GeirOPedersen #rebelforces #Damascus #UNHCR #UnitedNations #live #Reuters #News

Keep up with the latest news from around the world: https://www.reuters.com/

items.title: South Korea stocks rebound as policymakers vow to stabilize markets | REUTERS
items.author: Reuters
items.content:
South Korean shares rose more than 2%, rebounding sharply from a 13-month low, as authorities reaffirmed their decision to stabilize markets.

items.title: Suspect in killing of UnitedHealth CEO charged with murder | REUTERS
items.author: Reuters
items.content:
New York prosecutors filed a murder charge against Luigi Mangione, the suspect in the killing of UnitedHealth CEO Brian Thompson, a brazen shooting that set off a tense five-day manhunt that culminated in his capture in Pennsylvania.

items.title: K-pop and light sticks fire up impeachment protests in South Korea | REUTERS
items.author: Reuters
items.content:
While South Korean protesters have long employed songs, dances and chants, customized light sticks popular with K-pop fans have emerged as an effective new tool for demonstrators calling for the impeachment of President Yoon Suk Yeol.
